comments:
build I20030710
VM: pj9n131-20030627

- self hosting workspace with UI plugins in source, rest in binary
- set a breakpoint in the first line of PluginClassLoader's constructor
- debug target workspace
- breakpoint gets hit
- resume
- breakpoint gets hit again
- expand descriptor in Variables view
- Details pane shows: com.sun.jdi.InvocationException occurred invoking method.
- Resume
- process is terminated
- log has:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jul 14, 2003 13:33:57.603
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:54)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:68)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:63)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.debugId(PluginClassLoader.java:122)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.toString(DelegatingURLClassLoader.java:913)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.<init>(PluginClassLoader.java)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.getPluginClassLoader(PluginDescriptor.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.createXMLClassLoader(InternalPlatform.java:277)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup(InternalPlatform.java:692)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeImpl(Native Method)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeV(AccessibleObject.java:199)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:252)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:1049)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:838)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeImpl(Native Method)
	at java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.invokeL(AccessibleObject.java:207)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

Works OK if breakpoint is below assignment to descriptor field.
Problem is that the toString method (in the superclass) calls debugId() which
gets descriptor.
However, just because the debugger could not print something, this should not
cause the program being debugged to fail.

The termination only happens on SC. The program does not terminate on JDK1.4.1, 
and does not occurr when using SC without -Xj9.
